translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
Tenth Section
Discussion of the Path in One Who Has the Five Kinds of Consciousness

analyzed: pañca viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā ti
translated: Is there development of the path in one who has the five kinds of consciousness?
“Yes.”

analyzed: nanu pañca viññāṇā uppanna vatthukā uppanna ārammaṇā ti
translated: “Are not the five kinds of consciousness with an object that has arisen, with an object that has appeared?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci pañcaviññāṇā uppannavatthukā uppannārammaṇā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci pañca viññāṇāḥ uppanna vatthukāḥ uppanna ārammaṇāḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”

analyzed: pañca viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā ti
translated: “Then it is not right to say: ‘There is development of the path in one who has the five kinds of consciousness.’

original: Nanu pañcaviññāṇā purejātavatthukā purejātārammaṇā ajjhattikavatthukā bāhirārammaṇā
analyzed: nanu pañca viññāṇā purejāta vatthukā purejāta ārammaṇā ajjhattika vatthukā bāhira ārammaṇā
translated: “Are not the five kinds of consciousness with a prenascent object, with a postnascent object, with an internal object, with an external object,

original: asambhinnavatthukā asambhinnārammaṇā nānāvatthukā nānārammaṇā na aññamaññassa gocaravisayaṁ
analyzed: asambhinna vatthukāḥ asambhinna ārammaṇāḥ nānā vatthukāḥ nānā ārammaṇāḥ na aññamaññassa gocara visaya
translated: with an uncombined object, with a combined object, with a manifold object, with a single object, not experiencing each other’s range,

original: paccanubhonti, na asamannāhārā uppajjanti, na amanasikārā uppajjanti, na abbokiṇṇā
analyzed: paccanubhonti na a samannāhārāḥ uppajjanti na amanasikārāḥ uppajjanti na abbokiṇṇā
translated: arising without prompting, arising without minding, arising unprompted, arising unmindful,

original: uppajjanti, na apubbaṁ acarimaṁ uppajjanti, na aññamaññassa samanantarā uppajjanti,
analyzed: uppajjanti na apubbam acarimam uppajjanti na aññamaññassa samanantarāḥ uppajjanti
translated: arising neither in direct nor in reverse order, arising not in immediate sequence,
are not the five kinds of consciousness unaccompanied?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci pañcaviññāṇā anābhogā, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci pañca viññāṇāḥ anābhogāḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Are the five kinds of consciousness unprompted? You may not say so.

analyzed: pañca viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā ti
translated: “Is there development of the path for one possessing the five kinds of consciousness?”

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā ti
translated: “Is there development of the path for one possessing eye-consciousness?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam suññatam ārabbha uppajjati iti
translated: “Does eye-consciousness arise in dependence on the void?”
“You may not say so.”

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam suññatam ārabbha uppajjati iti
translated: “Does eye-consciousness arise in dependence on the void?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca suññatañca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇanti
translated: “Does eye-consciousness arise in dependence on the eye and the void?”
“You may not say so.”

analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca suññatañca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇanti
translated: “Does eye-consciousness arise in dependence on the eye and the void?”
“Yes.”

analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca suññatañca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇanti
translated: “‘Eye-consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and the void’—
is there such a suttanta?”
“No, there is not.”🔽

analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇam ti
translated: “‘Eye-consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms’—
is there such a suttanta?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci “cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇan”ti—
analyzed: hañci cakkhuñca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇanti
translated: “‘Eye-consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms’—

original: attheva suttanto, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: attha iva suttantaḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: is there such a suttanta? You may not say so.

analyzed: cakkhuñca paṭicca suññatañca uppajjati cakkhu viññāṇanti
translated: “Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and the void.”

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā ti
translated: Is there development of the path for one who is possessed of eye consciousness?
“Yes.”

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇam atīta anāgatam ārabbha uppajjati iti
translated: “Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on the past and future?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā ti
translated: “Is there development of the path for one who is possessed of eye consciousness?”
“Yes.”🔽“Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on contact?”
“Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on feeling?”🔽“Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on perception?”
“Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on intention?”🔽“Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on consciousness?”

analyzed: cakkhuṃ ārabbha pe  kāyam ārabbha pe
translated: “Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on the eye?” …🔽“Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on the body?” …
“Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on sound?” …
“Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on a tactile object?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Manoviññāṇasamaṅgissa atthi maggabhāvanā, manoviññāṇaṁ suññataṁ ārabbha uppajjatīti?
analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā manaḥ viññāṇam suññatam ārabbha uppajjati iti
translated: “Is there development of the path for one who is possessed of mind consciousness? Does mind consciousness arise in dependence on the void?”
“Yes.”

original: Cakkhuviññāṇasamaṅgissa atthi maggabhāvanā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ suññataṁ ārabbha uppajjatīti?
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā cakkhu viññāṇam suññatam ārabbha uppajjati iti
translated: “Is there development of the path for one who is possessed of eye consciousness? Does eye consciousness arise in dependence on the void?”🔽“No.”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: manoviññāṇasamaṅgissa atthi maggabhāvanā, manoviññāṇaṁ atītānāgataṁ ārabbha uppajjatīti?
analyzed: manaḥ viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā manaḥ viññāṇam atīta anāgatam ārabbha uppajjati iti
translated: Is there development of the path for one possessing mind-consciousness, and does it arise in dependence on past and future mind-consciousness?
“Yes.”

original: Cakkhuviññāṇasamaṅgissa atthi maggabhāvanā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ atītānāgataṁ ārabbha uppajjatīti?
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā cakkhu viññāṇam atīta anāgatam ārabbha uppajjati iti
translated: Is there development of the path for one possessing eye-consciousness, and does it arise in dependence on past and future eye-consciousness?

original: Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽manoviññāṇasamaṅgissa atthi maggabhāvanā, manoviññāṇaṁ phassaṁ ārabbha …🔽vedanaṁ ārabbha …pe…
analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  manaḥ viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā manaḥ viññāṇam phassam ārabbha  vedanam ārabbha pe
translated: “No.”🔽Is there development of the path for one possessing mind-consciousness, and does it arise in dependence on mind-consciousness?🔽In dependence on feeling? …
In dependence on contact?
“Yes.”

original: Cakkhuviññāṇasamaṅgissa atthi maggabhāvanā, cakkhuviññāṇaṁ phassaṁ ārabbha …
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā cakkhu viññāṇam phassam ārabbha
translated: Is there development of the path for one possessing eye-consciousness, and does it arise in dependence on eye-consciousness?
In dependence on feeling? …
In dependence on contact?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
You should not say:

analyzed: pañca viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā ti
translated: “There is development of the path for one possessing the five kinds of consciousness.”
“Yes.”
But has it not been said by the Blessed One:

original: “idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṁ disvā na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhī …pe…
analyzed: idha bhikkhave bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpam disvā na nimitta ggāhī hoti na anubyañjana ggāhī pe
translated: “Bhikkhus, here a bhikkhu, seeing a form with the eye, does not grasp its marks and features. …

analyzed: sotena saddam sutvā pe  ghānena gandham ghāyitvā pe
translated: Having heard a sound with the ear …🔽Having smelt an odour with the nose …
Having tasted a flavour with the tongue …

original: kāyena phoṭṭhabbaṁ phusitvā na nimittaggāhī hoti nānubyañjanaggāhī”ti.
analyzed: kāyena phoṭṭhabbam phusitvā na nimitta ggāhī hoti na anubyañjana ggāhī iti
translated: Having felt a tangible with the body, he does not grasp at its signs and features.”
Is there such a discourse?

analyzed: āmantā  tena hi pañca viññāṇa samaṅgissa atthi magga bhāvanā ti
translated: There is.🔽Well then, does one who is possessed of the five aggregates of grasping have development of the path?

analyzed: pañca viññāṇa samaṅgissa magga kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of one who is possessed of the five aggregates of grasping is finished.
